snippet: The small bodyguards who defend acacia trees in Eastern Africa against elephants and giraffes are being killed off by other ants.
abstract: Study in journal Ecology reports that invasive species known as bigheaded ant is killing off native ants in Eastern Africa, leading to dire consequences for acacia trees, which native ants protect; native ants fend off hungry elephants and giraffes by biting and stinging them when they try to eat the trees.
lead_paragraph: The small bodyguards who defend acacia trees in Eastern Africa against elephants and giraffes are being killed off by other ants.

headline.print_headline: Insects: Tree-Protecting Ants Can’t Protect Themselves
